alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 27 at 3:39AM MST until December 28 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW EXPECTED TO CONTINUE FOR THE MOUNTAINS THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WARNING EXTENDED UNTIL 8 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Additional accumulation of 6 to 12 inches for a storm total of 1 to 3 feet. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Sierra Madre and Snowy Range to include Centennial and Albany. * WHEN...Until 8 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Hikers and snow mobilers likely to become disoriented and lost with very poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
